entry.summary: szzhiyang: Does JetBrains have plans for a stand-alone Rust IDE?ï»¿ There are no such plans at the moment because we donâ€™t see additional value a separate Rust IDE would bring. It would require almost the same support as we already have for C/C++ in CLion, as well as C/C++ support owing to the widely-used language interop. From JetBrainsâ€™ standpoint, a potential Rust IDE equals CLion with the IntelliJ Rust plugin, so it doesnâ€™t make sense to invest resources in developing and supporting a separate product.

entry.title: Equal Columns With Flexbox: Itâ€™s More Complicated Than You Might Think
entry.summary: As awesome as flexbox is, what itâ€™s doing under the hood is actually a little strange because, by default, it is doing two things at once. It first looks at the content size which is what we would get if by declaring width: max-content on an element. But on top of that, flex-shrink is also doing some work allowing the items to be smaller, but only if needed. Letâ€™s break those two down and see how they work together. The post Equal Columns With Flexbox: Itâ€™s More Complicated Than You Might Think appeared first on CSS-Tricks. You can support CSS-Tricks by being an MVP Supporter.

entry.title: Building a Headless CMS with Fauna and Vercel Functions
entry.summary: In this tutorial, we will learn and use headless CMS, Fauna, and Vercel functions to build a blogging platform, Blogify After that, you can easily build any web application using a headless CMS, Fauna and Vercel functions. The post Building a Headless CMS with Fauna and Vercel Functions appeared first on CSS-Tricks. You can support CSS-Tricks by being an MVP Supporter.

orvice: As one of the users of Docker Hubâ€™s Autobuild service, we wanted to reach out and let you know that from June 18th, 2021 users on the free plan will no longer have access to the Autobuild feature. This means that any of your currently configured Autobuild will fail to run and you will need to upgrade to a Pro or Team account to restore functionality. You can read more about the changes on our blog.
Changes to Docker Hub Autobuilds https://www.docker.com/blog/changes-to-docker-hub-autobuilds/

Both devices must be signed in to iCloud with the same Apple ID using two-factor authentication. To use wirelessly, both devices must have Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and Handoff turned on and must be within 10 meters (30 feet) of each other. iPad and Mac must not be sharing a cellular and internet connection. To use over USB, you must trust your Mac on the iPad.â€

entry.summary: Modern apps place high demands on front-end developers. entry.title: Dynamic Favicons for WordPress
entry.summary: Typically, a single favicon is used across a whole domain. But there are times you wanna step it up with different favicons depending on context. A website might change the favicon to match the content being viewed. Or a site â€¦ The post Dynamic Favicons for WordPress appeared first on CSS-Tricks. You can support CSS-Tricks by being an MVP Supporter.

entry.title: Rethinking Postgres in a Post-Server World
entry.summary: Serverless architectures have brought engineering teams a great number of benefits. We get simpler deployments, automatic and infinite scale, better concurrency, and a stateless API surface. Itâ€™s hard to imagine going back to the world of managed services, broken local â€¦ The post Rethinking Postgres in a Post-Server World appeared first on CSS-Tricks. You can support CSS-Tricks by being an MVP Supporter.
